title: Display Engineer
summary: Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, phenomenal ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there’s no telling what you could accomplish. Apple Inc. is looking for a Display Engineer for the development and qualification of Displays for Apple Watch & iPhone products...
description: - Investigate the best display technologies from potential suppliers. - Define the display module specs for new Watch/iPhone projects. - Own an internal multi-functional team working with team members with optical, EE, ME, process and panel design expertise. - Handle the display suppliers as the primary technical contact window. - Perform the vital display testing and review test results from the display vendors, system OEMs, and multi-functional groups at Apple to ensure the performance specifications are met. - Identify all open engineering issues and drive them to closure with efficiency to support project needs. - Ensure display goals are met for engineering builds and initial mass production. Address issues from initial ramp and field returns related to displays and qualification of solutions
key_qualifications: Technical expertise and experience in a subset of the following fields are required: optical design and characterization, optical and/or human visual physics, semiconductor optoelectronics, display technologies, optical sensor technologies. Knowledge and experience in display specific optics is a strong plus. Hands-on experience in benchtop and industry standard optical measurement systems (characterization, test, and validation). Hands-on experience with programming languages used for data acquisition (Python, LabVIEW), statistical analysis (JMP, MATLAB) and/or optical simulation tools (LightTools). Experience with module engineering and mass production procedures is a strong plus...
education_experience: BS in Electrical Engineering or Physics and a minimum of 3 years relevant industry experience.
pay_benefits: At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $143,100 and $264,200, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs.
